Jargon Term: oxygen level at home was low
several different inhaled medications for your COPD

Annotation: Medical Issues - Complication developed in the hospital

Jargon Term: your blood showed that your oxygen was dangerously low.
Annotation: Medical Issues - Complication developed in the hospital

Jargon Term: Please take all medications as directed, and please use your home oxygen on a regular basis as this is very important to prevent further worsening in your oxygen levels.
Annotation: Aftercare instructions - patient needs to do - Medication

Jargon Term: For now, we recommend using 3L of oxygen when you walk, and can come down to 1.5L when resting, at least for the next 1 to 2 weeks.
Annotation: Aftercare instructions - patient needs to do - Other

Jargon Term: You will take 20mg Prednisone until you see Dr. [**First Name (STitle) 1022**] on the [**4-27**], at which time he can adjust the dose further.

Please call your PCP if you have any symptoms of increasing cough, trouble breathing, fever/chills, or other symptoms which are concerning to you. If your PCP is not available, please come to the nearest ED.
